intro: Calytrix ecalycata subsp. ecalycata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calytrix, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect shrub form. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
